raw_response:
```json
[
  {"entry_number": 1, "date": "2025-05-15", "content": "The house feels so empty tonight. He’s gone. This aching grief is a physical weight. How do I even start to breathe?"},
  {"entry_number": 2, "date": "2025-05-18", "content": "Kids were quiet at dinner. Max asked why Daddy doesn’t live here anymore. My heart shattered. Co-parenting already feels impossible."},
  {"entry_number": 3, "date": "2025-05-22", "content": "Just cried in the shower for twenty minutes. My identity feels stripped away. I'm Jordan, the divorced teacher. Is that all there is?"},
  {"entry_number": 4, "date": "2025-05-25", "content": "Met with the lawyer today. So many forms, so much paperwork. Each signature feels like another nail in the coffin. Exhausted."},
  {"entry_number": 5, "date": "2025-05-28", "content": "Talked to Sarah, my therapist. She said this grief is normal, that I need to be kind to myself. Hard to believe her words."},
  {"entry_number": 6, "date": "2025-06-01", "content": "Tried to plan summer activities with the kids. So many memories of past family trips flooded back. A wave of intense sadness."},
  {"entry_number": 7, "date": "2025-06-04", "content": "Had a passive-aggressive text exchange with Mark about school pick-ups. Co-parenting is a minefield. I just want peace for the kids."},
  {"entry_number": 8, "date": "2025-06-07", "content": "Graded papers until midnight. Work is a distraction, but also a reminder of who I was. I feel so disconnected from that person."},
  {"entry_number": 9, "date": "2025-06-11", "content": "Therapy session. We discussed setting boundaries with Mark. It feels daunting. I just want to avoid conflict, but it’s not working."},
  {"entry_number": 10, "date": "2025-06-14", "content": "Took the kids to the park. For a few hours, I almost felt normal. Then a couple walked by, and the grief hit again."},
  {"entry_number": 11, "date": "2025-06-17", "content": "Helped Lily with her science project. These moments are precious, reminding me of my strength. Still, the loneliness creeps in."},
  {"entry_number": 12, "date": "2025-06-21", "content": "Another fight with Mark over the kids' summer schedule. My head aches. This constant battle is draining my soul. Why can't we be civil?"},
  {"entry_number": 13, "date": "2025-06-24", "content": "Therapy today. Sarah encouraged me to find one small thing just for me. Maybe a new book? It feels selfish, though."},
  {"entry_number": 14, "date": "2025-06-27", "content": "Tried to cook a new recipe. It was a disaster. Laughed about it with Max and Lily, which was nice. A small victory, perhaps."},
  {"entry_number": 15, "date": "2025-07-01", "content": "Saw an old couple at the grocery store, still holding hands after all these years. Tears welled up. I miss that connection deeply."},
  {"entry_number": 16, "date": "2025-07-04", "content": "Managed to get through parent-teacher conferences. Professional self feels intact, but personal life is a tangled mess. So tired of pretending."},
  {"entry_number": 17, "date": "2025-07-07", "content": "Therapy. Discussed 're-parenting' myself. What does that even mean? I feel like a child lost in an adult's body."},
  {"entry_number": 18, "date": "2025-07-11", "content": "Kids spent the weekend with Mark. The quiet in the house was deafening. I tried to enjoy it, but just felt profoundly lonely."},
  {"entry_number": 19, "date": "2025-07-14", "content": "Cleaned out the garage today. Found old wedding photos. A punch to the gut. The memories are so vivid, so painful."},
  {"entry_number": 20, "date": "2025-07-17", "content": "Had coffee with my friend, Emily. She listened without judgment. It helps to feel seen, even if the pain doesn't go away."},
  {"entry_number": 21, "date": "2025-07-21", "content": "Therapy today. We talked about my anger towards Mark. Sarah says it's a part of grief. I just wish it wouldn't consume me."},
  {"entry_number": 22, "date": "2025-07-24", "content": "School's out for summer. The break is a double-edged sword. More time with kids, but also more time for my thoughts to spiral."},
  {"entry_number": 23, "date": "2025-07-27", "content": "Kids are fighting more. I feel caught in the middle. Is it the divorce? Am I failing them? My patience is wearing thin."},
  {"entry_number": 24, "date": "2025-07-31", "content": "Tried jogging today. Felt good to push my body. For a brief moment, I wasn't just 'Jordan the grieving wife,' but 'Jordan the runner.'"},
  {"entry_number": 25, "date": "2025-08-03", "content": "Therapy session. Sarah suggests exploring new hobbies. What even are my hobbies anymore? My identity feels like a blank slate."},
  {"entry_number": 26, "date": "2025-08-06", "content": "Took the kids to the beach. Max built an amazing sandcastle. Seeing them happy brings a bittersweet joy. I miss sharing this with Mark."},
  {"entry_number": 27, "date": "2025-08-10", "content": "Another tense phone call with Mark about finances. It's like pulling teeth. Why must everything be a battle? I hate this."},
  {"entry_number": 28, "date": "2025-08-13", "content": "Read a book for pleasure today. A small act of rebellion, taking time for myself. It felt good, a tiny whisper of who I used to be."},
  {"entry_number": 29, "date": "2025-08-16", "content": "Therapy. We talked about accepting the 'new normal.' It sounds so clinical. This is my shattered reality, not a normal I chose."},
  {"entry_number": 30, "date": "2025-08-20", "content": "Bought new school supplies for the kids. A fresh start for them, I hope. For me, it's just another cycle of pretending."},
  {"entry_number": 31, "date": "2025-08-23", "content": "Visited my sister. She's so supportive, but I still feel like a burden. The shame of divorce still clings to me."},
  {"entry_number": 32, "date": "2025-08-26", "content": "First day back at school. Seeing my colleagues felt comforting. A small sense of routine returning. This part of my identity feels solid."},
  {"entry_number": 33, "date": "2025-08-30", "content": "Therapy today. We focused on mindfulness. Trying to be present, not dwell on the past or fear the future. It's incredibly hard work."},
  {"entry_number": 34, "date": "2025-09-02", "content": "Kids started their new classes. Lily seems a bit withdrawn. My heart aches for them, navigating this upheaval. I wish I could protect them more."},
  {"entry_number": 35, "date": "2025-09-05", "content": "Received the final divorce decree. It's done. A strange mix of relief and profound sadness. An ending, but what's the beginning?"},
  {"entry_number": 36, "date": "2025-09-09", "content": "Had dinner with a friend from work. We talked about everything except the divorce. It was a refreshing break from my own head for a while."},
  {"entry_number": 37, "date": "2025-09-12", "content": "Therapy session. Sarah said it's okay to feel joy amidst the grief. I saw a beautiful sunset today and felt a flicker. Hope?"},
  {"entry_number": 38, "date": "2025-09-15", "content": "Found myself humming an old song Mark and I loved. The nostalgia was overwhelming. Some days, the memories just ambush me."},
  {"entry_number": 39, "date": "2025-09-19", "content": "Helped Max with his math homework. Felt good to be a 'normal' parent. These small moments are grounding me. I need them."},
  {"entry_number": 40, "date": "2025-09-22", "content": "Another argument with Mark over vacation plans. He's so unreasonable sometimes. Co-parenting truly tests every ounce of my patience."},
  {"entry_number": 41, "date": "2025-09-25", "content": "Therapy today. We explored my fears about being alone forever. It's a huge fear. Sarah helped me reframe it as a chance for self-discovery."},
  {"entry_number": 42, "date": "2025-09-29", "content": "Kids had a great time at the fair. Seeing their smiles truly lifted my spirits. My identity as their mother feels stronger than ever."},
  {"entry_number": 43, "date": "2025-10-02", "content": "Went for a long walk in the woods. The quiet was exactly what I needed. Just me, my thoughts, and the rustling leaves. Peace, for a moment."},
  {"entry_number": 44, "date": "2025-10-05", "content": "Received a sweet drawing from a student. Such a small gesture, but it reminded me of the positive impact I have. It felt good."},
  {"entry_number": 45, "date": "2025-10-09", "content": "Therapy session. We talked about forgiveness. Not for Mark, but for myself. For mistakes I think I made. It's a heavy topic."},
  {"entry_number": 46, "date": "2025-10-12", "content": "Mark canceled on the kids last minute. They were devastated. I had to pick up the pieces. My anger towards him is so fierce."},
  {"entry_number": 47, "date": "2025-10-15", "content": "Tried a yoga class after work. It was challenging, but good. My body felt stiff, but my mind felt clearer afterwards. A new routine?"},
  {"entry_number": 48, "date": "2025-10-19", "content": "A student told me I was her favorite teacher. It warmed my heart. This job is a constant, positive force in my life."},
  {"entry_number": 49, "date": "2025-10-22", "content": "Therapy today. We discussed rebuilding my social life. The idea of dating feels terrifying, utterly impossible right now. My identity isn't ready."},
  {"entry_number": 50, "date": "2025-10-25", "content": "Kids had a movie night at home. Popcorn, blankets, laughter. These simple moments are becoming my new anchors. I cherish them."},
  {"entry_number": 51, "date": "2025-10-29", "content": "Woke up feeling surprisingly okay. No immediate wave of sadness. Just a quiet morning. Is this what healing feels like, sometimes?"},
  {"entry_number": 52, "date": "2025-11-01", "content": "Had a difficult parent meeting at school. Felt confident and capable. My professional identity is strong, even if my personal one is still forming."},
  {"entry_number": 53, "date": "2025-11-04", "content": "Therapy session. Explored my definition of happiness now. It's less about grand gestures, more about quiet contentment and moments of peace."},
  {"entry_number": 54, "date": "2025-11-08", "content": "Max got a perfect score on his spelling test. So proud of him! Small joys are truly getting me through these challenging times."},
  {"entry_number": 55, "date": "2025-11-11", "content": "Received a bill for something Mark was supposed to pay. Furious. This constant reminder of his irresponsibility is exhausting. Co-parenting nightmare."},
  {"entry_number": 56, "date": "2025-11-14", "content": "Spent the evening organizing my classroom. Found a sense of control in the small task. A quiet evening, much needed after the stress."},
  {"entry_number": 57, "date": "2025-11-18", "content": "Therapy today. We talked about building a support system beyond just Emily. It feels vulnerable to reach out, but also necessary."},
  {"entry_number": 58, "date": "2025-11-21", "content": "Took Lily costume shopping for Halloween. She was so excited. Her joy is infectious, pulling me out of my own head for a bit."},
  {"entry_number": 59, "date": "2025-11-24", "content": "The weather turned cold today. Pulled out my winter coat. Small shifts in season feel poignant, reflecting the changes in my own life."},
  {"entry_number": 60, "date": "2025-11-28", "content": "Helped a student struggling with reading. That moment of understanding in her eyes—it makes every difficult day worth it. My purpose."},
  {"entry_number": 61, "date": "2025-12-01", "content": "Therapy session. Discussed coping with the upcoming holidays without Mark. It feels daunting, a huge hurdle for my healing process and grief."},
  {"entry_number": 62, "date": "2025-12-04", "content": "Kids had their school play tonight. They were both amazing! Felt so proud, cheering them on. A real boost for my spirit."},
  {"entry_number": 63, "date": "2025-12-08", "content": "Caught myself smiling in the mirror today. A genuine smile. It felt foreign, but good. A tiny spark of myself returning."},
  {"entry_number": 64, "date": "2025-12-11", "content": "Mark wants to spend Thanksgiving with the kids. I feel a knot in my stomach. Co-parenting is never easy, especially on holidays."},
  {"entry_number": 65, "date": "2025-12-14", "content": "Therapy today. Sarah helped me plan strategies for managing holiday stress and loneliness. I feel a bit more prepared now."},
  {"entry_number": 66, "date": "2025-12-18", "content": "Thanksgiving was hard. Kids missed Mark, I missed our old life. Felt a deep wave of grief. But we got through it, just us three."},
  {"entry_number": 67, "date": "2025-12-21", "content": "Decorated for Christmas with the kids. It felt different, but still joyful. Creating new traditions, piece by piece. My identity evolving."},
  {"entry_number": 68, "date": "2025-12-24", "content": "Had coffee with another teacher. We talked about curriculum, then she shared her own divorce story. It was incredibly validating. I'm not alone."},
  {"entry_number": 69, "date": "2025-12-28", "content": "Therapy session. We celebrated a small breakthrough: I didn't let Mark's negativity ruin my day. Progress, not perfection, as Sarah says."},
  {"entry_number": 70, "date": "2025-12-31", "content": "Helped Lily write her letter to Santa. Her pure belief is a precious thing. I try to hold onto that innocence for them."},
  {"entry_number": 71, "date": "2026-01-03", "content": "Finished all my Christmas shopping. Actually felt a little festive. The joy of giving is a powerful antidote to grief."},
  {"entry_number": 72, "date": "2026-01-07", "content": "Went to the kids' holiday concert. Saw Mark across the room. We exchanged a polite nod. It was civil, a small win for co-parenting."},
  {"entry_number": 73, "date": "2026-01-10", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed the concept of 'radical acceptance' for the holidays. It's difficult, but feels like the path forward."},
  {"entry_number": 74, "date": "2026-01-13", "content": "Kids are with Mark for Christmas Eve. The house is silent. A pang of loneliness, but also a quiet calm. I'm learning to sit with it."},
  {"entry_number": 75, "date": "2026-01-17", "content": "Christmas Day was sweet, just me and the kids. We made pancakes and opened gifts. It felt simpler, authentic. A new kind of happiness."},
  {"entry_number": 76, "date": "2026-01-20", "content": "Boxed up the decorations. Feeling exhausted but also a sense of accomplishment. I survived the first holiday season alone. Big step."},
  {"entry_number": 77, "date": "2026-01-23", "content": "Therapy session. Reflected on the year. So much pain, but also growth. I'm not the same Jordan, and that's okay. It's a new identity."},
  {"entry_number": 78, "date": "2026-01-27", "content": "New Year's Day. Woke up feeling hopeful, surprisingly. No resolutions, just a gentle intention to keep moving forward. One day at a time."},
  {"entry_number": 79, "date": "2026-01-30", "content": "Back to school routine. The structure is comforting. I thrive on purpose, and teaching provides that for me. I am a teacher."},
  {"entry_number": 80, "date": "2026-02-02", "content": "Mark and I had a decent conversation about the kids' school reports. No arguments, just factual. Co-parenting showing signs of improvement. Relief."},
  {"entry_number": 81, "date": "2026-02-06", "content": "Therapy today. We talked about envisioning my future. What do *I* want? Not what Mark wanted, not what society expects. It's liberating."},
  {"entry_number": 82, "date": "2026-02-09", "content": "Lily asked if we could get a new pet. The thought of responsibility is daunting, but her excitement is contagious. Maybe a fish?"},
  {"entry_number": 83, "date": "2026-02-12", "content": "Had a productive day at work. Felt truly engaged with my students. My professional self is a solid foundation amidst the changes."},
  {"entry_number": 84, "date": "2026-02-16", "content": "Caught myself laughing loudly with the kids over a silly movie. A genuine, unburdened laugh. It felt wonderful. A true gift."},
  {"entry_number": 85, "date": "2026-02-19", "content": "Therapy session. Discussed self-compassion. I'm so hard on myself. Learning to treat myself with the same kindness I offer my students."},
  {"entry_number": 86, "date": "2026-02-22", "content": "Went to a school fundraiser. Socialized with other parents. Didn't feel awkward or lonely. A small victory for my new identity."},
  {"entry_number": 87, "date": "2026-02-26", "content": "Helped Max prepare for a debate competition. He's so bright. Being their mother is my greatest joy and most enduring identity."},
  {"entry_number": 88, "date": "2026-03-01", "content": "Spent the evening journaling, just for me. Reflecting on how far I've come. The grief is still there, but it's not all-consuming."},
  {"entry_number": 89, "date": "2026-03-04", "content": "Therapy today. We explored my emerging sense of self. It's still a work in progress, but I feel a hopeful direction now."},
  {"entry_number": 90, "date": "2026-03-08", "content": "Received a nice email from Mark regarding a school event. Professional and brief. Co-parenting is settling into a manageable rhythm."},
  {"entry_number": 91, "date": "2026-03-11", "content": "Tried a new recipe, just for me. It turned out delicious! Enjoyed a quiet meal, savoring the flavors and my own company."},
  {"entry_number": 92, "date": "2026-03-15", "content": "A student was struggling, and I felt genuinely able to help. My experience has made me more empathetic, I think. A new strength."},
  {"entry_number": 93, "date": "2026-03-18", "content": "Therapy session. We talked about future goals. I'm cautiously optimistic about pursuing a leadership role at school. A new challenge."},
  {"entry_number": 94, "date": "2026-03-22", "content": "Kids had a sleepover with friends. Enjoyed the quiet evening, read a book. Didn't feel lonely, just peaceful. This is progress."},
  {"entry_number": 95, "date": "2026-03-25", "content": "Visited a local art gallery. Felt inspired by the colors and forms. Rediscovering parts of myself I thought were lost. My inner world."},
  {"entry_number": 96, "date": "2026-03-28", "content": "Helped Lily pick out a birthday gift for a friend. Seeing her navigate friendships reminds me of my own journey. Growth."},
  {"entry_number": 97, "date": "2026-04-01", "content": "Therapy today. Sarah said I've made incredible progress. I actually believe her. The grief is still present, but it's no longer defining me."},
  {"entry_number": 98, "date": "2026-04-04", "content": "Had a lovely dinner with Emily. Laughed so much my cheeks hurt. Genuine connection feels so good. I'm building a new life."},
  {"entry_number": 99, "date": "2026-04-07", "content": "Walked the dog with Max and Lily. The spring air felt fresh, full of promise. We talked, we laughed. Life is moving forward."},
  {"entry_number": 100, "date": "2026-04-11", "content": "Today, I felt truly happy. Not a fleeting moment, but a deep sense of peace. I am Jordan, strong, resilient, and ready for what's next."}
```
